info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 4:51PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Thomas, southwestern Rawlins and northeastern Sherman Counties through 415 PM MDT/515 PM CDT/... At 350 PM MDT/450 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Brewster, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Thomas, southwestern Rawlins and northeastern Sherman Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
